name: Auto Assign Ticket on Open
script:
if doc.status == "Open":
    current_user = frappe.session.user
    
    # Get current assignments from database
    current_assigns_raw = frappe.db.get_value("HD Ticket", doc.name, "_assign")
    
    # Parse assignments
    if current_assigns_raw:
        assigns_list = json.loads(current_assigns_raw)
    else:
        assigns_list = []
    
    # Check if user is already assigned
    if current_user not in assigns_list:
        # Add current user to list
        assigns_list.append(current_user)
        
        # Update the _assign field in database
        frappe.db.sql("""
            UPDATE `tabHD Ticket` 
            SET _assign = %s 
            WHERE name = %s
        """, (json.dumps(assigns_list), doc.name))
        
        # Create ToDo entry for proper assignment tracking
        todo = frappe.get_doc({
            "doctype": "ToDo",
            "allocated_to": current_user,
            "reference_type": "HD Ticket",
            "reference_name": doc.name,
            "description": f"Ticket {doc.name}",
            "status": "Open",
            "priority": "Medium",
            "assigned_by": frappe.session.user
        })
        todo.insert(ignore_permissions=True)

name: Auto team assign
For Customer
script:
if doc.has_value_changed('custom_customercode'):
    # Get all tickets for this customer
    tickets = frappe.get_all(
        'HD Ticket',
        filters={
            'Customer': doc.name
        },
        fields=['name']
    )
    
    # Update each ticket's custom_customercode field (in memory only)
    for ticket in tickets:
        # Get the ticket document
        ticket_doc = frappe.get_doc('HD Ticket', ticket.name)
        
        # Update the custom_customercode field
        ticket_doc.custom_customercode = doc.custom_customercode
        
        # Use db_set to update without triggering validations or workflows
        # This will update the field value in memory/cache
        frappe.db.set_value('HD Ticket', ticket.name, 'custom_customercode', doc.custom_customercode, update_modified=False)
    
    
    frappe.msgprint(f'Updated Customer Code in {len(tickets)} ticket(s)', alert=True)
